intro: Ruehssia weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's ruehssia, is a flowering plant species native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, featuring narrow, leathery leaves and produces small, fragrant white or yellowish flowers. It is often found in humid, shaded environments at higher elevations. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
